summary: The Youth Poisoning Protection Act aims to ban the sale of consumer products containing a high concentration (10% or more by weight) of sodium nitrite. The bill amends the Consumer Product Safety Act, declaring such products as banned hazardous products. Exemptions are provided for commercial and industrial uses, as well as products that are classified as drugs, devices, cosmetics, or food, including poultry, meat, and eggs. The ban takes effect 90 days after enactment.
